fields.title: Manage your ad network setup
fields.body: Once you've set up your ad network, you can: - View a list of all ad networks that you've set up. - Drill down to view or edit campaign, adgroup, and creative levels of the link. - View a comparison of attribution settings across all your links. - View and edit your data sharing setup. ## [Ad networks list](ad-networks-list) This section provides a list of all ad networks that you've set up. You can access the list by selecting __Campaign Lab > Partners__. __Available details__ - A list of all ad networks that you've set up. - The number of apps with links for each ad network. - The number of apps with data sharing enabled. __Tasks__ - Select an ad network to view an overview of the network-level details of the link. - Select __New link__ to [create a link for this ad network](/en/article/ad-network-setup) for an app. - Select __New partner__ to [set up an ad network](/en/article/ad-network-setup) for an app. ## [Link overview](link-overview) This section provides details of your link and your ad network setup. Select an ad network from the __Partners__ list to view an overview of the network-level details of a link. __Available details__ - The name of the app for which the link was set up. - The network-level name of the link. - The number of campaigns set up on this link. - A badge showing the link as: - (spam) - Flagged as a spam link due to click spamming. - (blocklisted) - [Blocklisted links](#blocklisted-links) using the Blocklist API. __Task__ - Drill down into the [structure of your link](/en/article/manage-ad-network-setup#link-structure). ### [Link structure](link-structure) This section provides details on how you can drill down into the structure of your link. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select an ad network that you've set up to view the network-level details of the link. - View the network-level name of the link. - View the number of configured campaigns. - Select the network name or (Edit icon) to view or edit network-level details. You can modify the [link structure](/en/article/link-structure-ad-network), [user destinations](/en/article/user-destinations-ad-network), and [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the network-level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the click URL, impression URL, and link token, or download the link as a QR code in the SVG or PNG format. 3. Under __Campaigns__, select the campaign number or (Drill down icon) to drill down into campaign details. - View the campaign-level name of the link. - View the number of configured adgroups. - Select the campaign name or (Edit icon) to view or edit campaign-level details. You can modify the [link structure](/en/article/link-structure-ad-network), [user destinations](/en/article/user-destinations-ad-network), and [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the campaign-level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the click URL, impression URL, and link token, or download the link as a QR code in the SVG or PNG format. 4. Under __Adgroups__, select the adgroup number or (Drill down icon) to drill down into adgroup details. - View the adgroup-level name of the link. - View the number of configured creatives. - Select the adgroup name or (Edit icon) to view or edit adgroup-level details. You can modify the [link structure](/en/article/link-structure-ad-network), [user destinations](/en/article/user-destinations-ad-network), and [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the adgroup-level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the click URL, impression URL, and link token, or download the link as a QR code in the SVG or PNG format. 5. Under __Creatives__, select the creative number or (Drill down icon) to drill down into creative details. - View the creative-level name of the link. - Select the creative name or (Edit icon) to view or edit creative-level details. You can modify the [link structure](/en/article/link-structure-ad-network), [user destinations](/en/article/user-destinations-ad-network), and [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the creative-level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the click URL, impression URL, and link token, or download the link as a QR code in the SVG or PNG format. +++> ### [Define custom data point](define-custom-data-point) #### OPTIONAL You can add a single custom data point to your link to analyze your data, outside of Adjust. This data point is not visible in your __Dashboards__ or __Reports__, but can be exported in your server callbacks or cloud storage uploads. To add a custom data point, follow these steps. 1. On the __Link structure__ tab, under __Define your additional parameter__, select __Add parameter__. 2. Enter the custom data point name in the __Label parameter__ field. 3. Select __Save__. +++< ## [Attribution settings comparison](attribution-settings-comparison) This section provides a comparison of [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) across all your links for an ad network. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select an ad network that you've set up to view an overview of the network-level details of the link. 3. Select __Attribution comparison__. __Available details__ - The name of the app for which the link was set up. - The values of click and impression attribution for: - Device matching - probabilistic modeling - Temporary attribution - The values of click and impression reattribution for: - Inactivity period - Reattribution window - Temporary reattribution - Custom attribution settings are highlighted. __Tasks__ - To modify an attribution setting, select its value and change it. Select __Save__. - Select the network-level name to view all attribution settings of the link. - Select the campaign number or (Drill down icon) to view or modify a comparison of the attribution settings for the campaign-level of the link. - From the campaign-level, select the adgroup number or (Drill down icon) to view or modify a comparison of the attribution settings for the adgroup-level of the link. From the agroup-level, select the creative number or (Drill down icon) to view or modify a comparison of the attribution settings for the adgroup-level of the link. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) This section provides details of your data sharing setup. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select an ad network that you've set up. 3. Select the __Data sharing__ tab. __Available details__ - The name of the app for which data sharing was set up. - The sources from which data is shared with the network. - The data points shared with the network. - The number of mapped events and parameters. - The data sharing status (__Active__ or __Paused__). __Tasks__ - Change data sharing status. - Select (Pause icon) to pause sharing data with your network. - Select (Resume icon) to start sharing data with your network again. - Select (Edit icon) to modify your [data sharing](/en/article/data-sharing-ad-network) settings. ## [Blocklist links](Blocklisted-links) With Adjust's [blocklist API](/en/article/blocklist-api), you can block traffic from fraudulent or outdated link URLs. Blocklisted links keep their existing attributions (until the user is reattributed to another link), but aren't able to report new engagements. Blocklisted links still appear in Campaign Lab, but are marked by the (blocklisted) badge. Clicks and impressions recorded before you blocklist a link stay eligible for attribution. For example, if you set a 7-day attribution window and blocklist a link on day 2, Adjust will still consider engagements from day 1 for attribution. You can use Adjust's blocklist API to [unblocklist link URLs](/en/article/unblocklist-tracker). After you unblocklist a link, you can edit its settings in Campaign Lab, and we'll immediately start recording engagements again. Note that unblocklisting doesn't retroactively apply to your attribution data—Adjust will only consider clicks and impressions _after_ the unblocklisting for attribution. Adjust can also flag links as (spam) from attributing to fraudulent traffic due to click spam. We do not unblock links flagged due to spam. We also stop reporting new engagements to spam links.

fields.title: Set up Facebook in Adjust
fields.body:
With Adjust’s Facebook integration, you can measure the performance of your marketing efforts on Facebook, Facebook Messenger, Instagram, and Facebook Audience Network. ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) Here's what you need to know before getting started. __Requirements__ - A registered [Facebook app](/en/article/set-up-an-app-in-your-facebook-developer-account) - Adjust SDK v4.0.0 and later to map SDK parameters to network parameters. Follow the guides linked below to use this feature.
[iOS](/en/article/record-events-ios-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Android](/en/article/event-tracking-android-sdk#partner-parameters) / [Windows](https://github.com/adjust/windows_sdk#8-partner-parameters) / [Unity](/en/article/measure-events-unity-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [React Native](/en/article/measure-events-react-native-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Flutter](/en/article/measure-events-flutter-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Adobe Air](https://github.com/adjust/adobe_air_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Cordova](https://github.com/adjust/cordova_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Marmalade](https://github.com/adjust/marmalade_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Xamarin](https://github.com/adjust/xamarin_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Cocos2d-x](https://github.com/adjust/cocos2dx_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Titanium](https://github.com/adjust/titanium_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Corona](https://github.com/adjust/corona_sdk#partner-parameters) If you’ve migrated to Adjust, are a new client, or are adding a new app, you need to connect Adjust as a data source in Facebook Events Manager. If you don’t complete this step, Facebook can’t claim any engagements measured by Adjust. ## [Initial setup and review](initial-setup) To set up Facebook for your app: 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select __New partner__. 3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose __Facebook__, and select __Next__. 4. In the __App selection__ screen, choose your app, and select __Next__. You can now set your [data sharing](#data-sharing) options and map Adjust events and parameters for Facebook to receive. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) Share data with Facebook to optimize your campaigns. In the __Data sharing__ screen, follow these steps. ### [Enable data sharing for Facebook](enable-data-sharing-facebook) 1. In the __App ID__ field, enter your Facebook Developer App ID. Your Facebook Developer App ID comes from your Facebook Developer account. This App ID should be the same for all your apps in Adjust, regardless of platform. - Follow the steps in Facebook documentation to find your [Facebook Developer App ID](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/development/create-an-app). 2. (Optional) In the __Decryption key__ field, enter your decryption key. This enriches your raw data with certain [campaign details for Android apps](/en/article/facebook-raw-data-reporting-for-android). - Follow the steps in Facebook documentation to find your [Decryption key](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/app-ads/install-referrer/#step-1--get-the-decryption-key). ### [Set your data sharing options](set-your-data-sharing-options) Once you enable data sharing, Adjust sends data from all attribution sources to Facebook, by default. This includes data attributed to Facebook, data attributed to other networks, and organic data. You can select to send additional data to Facebook. This inclues: - __Ad revenue (from ad views):__ to send your ad revenue callbacks to Facebook. Your ad revenue data will display in Facebook Ads Manager under `fb_mobile_purchase`. This value is hardcoded and cannot be changed. - __Uninstalls and reinstalls:__ to send uninstall and reinstall data to Facebook. This is available only if you have purchased [Adjust's Uninstall and Reinstall Growth Solution](https://help.adjust.com/en/article/uninstalls-reinstalls). - __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases):__ to send detailed revenue data to your Facebook Ads Manager dashboard. You need to [map events](#map-events) that generate revenue to share this data. - __Parameters:__ to share all partner parameters configured in the Adjust SDK for any activity you share with Facebook. You usually need to [map parameters](#map-parameters) to share this data. #### [(iOS apps only) Aggregated Event Measurement](ios-apps-only-enable-aggregated-event-measurement) [Facebook's Aggregated Event Measurement](https://www.facebook.com/business/help/721422165168355?id=1877298665783613) (AEM) is a protocol that measures app events from iOS 14.5 and later. With AEM, you can set up two types of campaign: - __Mobile App Install (MAI):__ for new user acquisition campaigns. - __Mobile App Re-Engagement (MAE):__ for retargeting and re-engagement campaigns directed at existing users. Adjust's Facebook integration automatically supports MAI campaigns. So to get set up for MAI, you need to: 1. [Set up the Facebook partner module](#enable-data-sharing-facebook). 2. [Map events](#map-events) that you want to send to Facebook for measurement. If you want to run MAE campaigns, you need to complete these two additional steps: 3. [Configure an app scheme and enable universal linking](/en/article/user-destinations-ad-network#deep-link) in your app. 4. Turn on the toggle for __Enable AEM for MAE__. This indicates to Facebook that they can use the Aggregated Event Measurement protocol to measure events from your app. Once dashboard setup is complete and you're ready to launch your campaign, make sure to also [set up your raw data to receive MAE campaign information](/en/article/facebook-raw-data-reporting#ios-only-receive-mae-campaign-information-in-raw-data). #### [Configure additional integration settings](configure-additional-integration-settings) 1. Adjust measures reattributions for Facebook automatically. With the toggle for __Enable reattribution measurement__ ON, Adjust sends all app sessions to Facebook. If Facebook can show a qualifying engagement, it will be awarded a reattribution. 2. With the toggle for __Enable limited data use (CCPA)__ ON, you stay compliant with CCPA. This signals to Facebook when California-based users opt out of having their data disclosed or shared with third parties. ### [Map events](map-events) If you've already set up app event measurement in your Facebook SDK, don't set up event mapping between Adjust and Facebook. This will duplicate your event data in Facebook. If you have questions, reach out to support@adjust.com. You can share in-app event data with Facebook directly for precise targeting. This is required for event-based bid optimization. #### Standard events To optimize your Facebook campaigns on Adjust events, you must link each event to one of the standard Facebook events. Below you can see how each available Facebook event appears in Adjust. Read [Facebook's documentation](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/app-ads/optimizing-your-app-ad#app-event-optimization) for more information about events. $$$> - `fb_mobile_level_achieved` - `fb_mobile_add_payment_info` - `fb_mobile_add_to_cart` - `fb_mobile_add_to_wishlist` - `fb_mobile_complete_registration` - `fb_mobile_tutorial_completion` - `fb_mobile_initiated_checkout` - `fb_mobile_purchase` - `fb_mobile_rate` - `fb_mobile_search` - `fb_mobile_spent_credits` - `fb_mobile_achievement_unlocked` - `fb_mobile_content_view` === - `Subscribe` - `StartTrial` - `AdClick` - `AdImpression` - `Contact` - `CustomizeProduct` - `Donate` - `FindLocation` - `Lead` - `PageView` - `Schedule` - `SubmitApplication` $$$< #### Custom events With Facebook’s custom event optimization, you can directly optimize custom app events from your campaign in Facebook. These custom events are available to most App Install campaigns, including Automated App Ads and Manual App Ads. All you need to do is link your Adjust events as custom events, and Adjust passes them to Facebook for optimization. If you selected __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to your Facebook Ads Manager dashboard, you need to map events that generate revenue. To map your events, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map event__. 2. In the __Adjust event__ list, select the Adjust event that you want to share with Facebook. 3. In the __Partner event__ list, select the Facebook event that corresponds to your Adjust event, or else enter a custom event name. 4. Select __Apply__. ### [Map parameters](map-parameters) If the raw data parameters you collect in the SDK differ from the values supported by Facebook, you can define mappings so that Facebook can receive that data. You can view this section only if you have selected __Parameters__ under __Set your data sharing options__. To map your parameters, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map parameter__. 2. In the __SDK parameter__ field, enter the name of your Adjust partner parameter as written in the Adjust SDK. 3. In the __Partner parameter__ field, enter the corresponding Facebook parameter name. 4. Select __Apply__. Adjust forwards custom event details directly to Facebook for any of your linked events. ## [Review setup](review-setup) Once you're done, review your selection and enable Adjust measurement for Facebook on your app. 1. In the __Setup review__ screen, review your settings and make any necessary changes. 2. Select __Enable network__ to enable Facebook measurement for your app. You don't need to create a link for Facebook. The links are created automatically after you set up and start a campaign with Facebook. Adjust then starts attributing users to your campaigns. ## [Campaign setup in Facebook](setup-in-facebook) Now that you've enabled Adjust measurement with Facebook for your app, you need to set up your campaign in Facebook. 1. Set up your campaign in the Facebook Ads Manager dashboard. - Corresponding links are created automatically and appear on the network details page. 2. (Optional) Customize your attribution settings from the Facebook network details page. This is available only after you set up your campaign in the Facebook Ads Manager dashboard. - Facebook only claims click-based sessions in their API, not impression-based sessions. For this reason, Adjust can only measure click-based reattributions for Facebook, not impression-based reattributions.

fields.title: Custom link setup
fields.body:
Custom links are links created for campaigns that are not run through an ad network. These links can be used in emails, social media posts or profiles, owned websites, influencer campaigns, and so on.

With this end-to-end setup, you can:
- [x] Create a link for your apps
- [x] Add sub-level links
- [x] Set up deep links based on user's device type
- [x] Set attribution settings at the link level

## [Before you begin](before-you-begin)

Here's what you need to know before getting started.

__Requirements__

- Admin, Editor, or Custom Editor [permissions](/en/article/permission-levels)
   - You should be able to create a link after you have added an app. If you face any issues, reach out to your Technical Account Manager or contact [support@adjust.com](mailto:support@adjust.com).

## [Combined custom links](combined-custom-links)

With custom links for a single-platform or a multi-platform app, you can only target the platforms that you've configured for that app. 

If you're running a campaign where it is not possible to target a specific platform, you need to create a combined custom link. 

__Example:__ While running a campaign with an influencer on Instagram / YouTube, you do not know the devices of the target users. In this case, choose the Android app and iOS app that you added in AppView to create your combined custom link in Campaign Lab. A combined custom link has multiple link tokens specific to each app and can target users on Android and iOS with a single link.

## [Get started](get-started)

To get started with creating your custom link, follow these steps.

1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Custom links__.
2. Select __New link__.
3. In the __[App selection](/en/article/app-selection-custom-link)__ screen, choose the apps for which you want to create the link.
   - Choosing one single-platform app or a multi-platform app creates a link wth a single link token.
   - Choosing multiple apps configured for different platforms creates a combined link with multiple link tokens, each separated by an `_`. You can only select one app per platform.
4. In the __[Link structure](/en/article/link-structure-custom-link)__ screen, add a name for your top-level channel link. Optionally, add campaign, adgroup, and creative sub-levels to set up your link structure.
5. (Optional) In the __[User destinations](/en/article/user-destinations-custom-link)__ screen, provide information for deep links, redirects, and fallbacks to add to your link.
6. (Optional) In the __[Attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network)__ screen, set custom attribution settings for new and existing users. These attribution settings are available for clicks only.  If you skip this step, attribution settings that you chose during app setup will apply. 
7. In the __[Link review](/en/article/review-setup-create-custom-link)__ screen, review your choices, and make any changes as necessary. 
8. Select __Create link__ to generate the click URL, QR code, and link token.

## [Next steps](next-steps)

Share the link with your team or partners to use in campaigns.

fields.title: FAQs
fields.description: Frequently asked questions about the Adjust SDK for Android.
fields.body: +++> ### [What is the "Session failed (Ignoring too frequent session…)" error?](session-failed-too-frequent-session) This error usually occurs when testing installs. Uninstalling and reinstalling the app is not enough to trigger a new install. The backend will determine that the SDK has lost its local session data. It will ignore the message given the information available about the device. The backend behaves this way to make sure the sandbox behavior matches production. You can reset app session data for a device from the [Testing Console](/en/article/testing-console#forget-device). This requires Editor-level access or higher for the app you are working on. Once you have removed the device from the Testing Console, it will return __Forgot device__. If the device was already forgotten or the values were incorrect, it will return __Advertising ID not found__. Forgetting the device will not reverse the GDPR forget me call. If you have access to the [Device API](/en/article/device-api), you can use this to inspect and forget devices. === ### [Is my broadcast receiver capturing the install referrer?](is-broadcast-receiver-capturing-install-referrer) If you have followed the [get started guide](/en/article/get-started-android-sdk#set-up-install-referrer), you should have configured your receiver. The receiver will send the install referrer to the Adjust SDK and the Adjust backend. You can test this by triggering a test install referrer. Run the following with the [`adb`](http://developer.android.com/tools/help/adb.html) tool in Android Studio. Remember to replace `com.your.appid` with your app ID. ```bash adb shell am broadcast -a com.android.vending.INSTALL_REFERRER -n com.your.appid/com.adjust.sdk.AdjustReferrerReceiver --es "referrer" "adjust_reftag%3Dabc1234%26tracking_id%3D123456789%26utm_source%3Dnetwork%26utm_medium%3Dbanner%26utm_campaign%3Dcampaign" ``` In some cases you may use a different receiver for the `INSTALL_REFERRER` intent. If you have followed [this guide](/en/article/multiple-broadcast-receivers-android-sdk), replace `com.adjust.sdk.AdjustReferrerReceiver` with your broadcast receiver. You can also remove the `-n com.your.appid/com.adjust.sdk.AdjustReferrerReceiver` parameter so that all the apps in the device will receive the `INSTALL_REFERRER` intent. If you set the log level to `verbose`, you should be able to see the log from reading the referrer: ```text V/Adjust: Referrer to parse (adjust_reftag=abc1234&tracking_id=123456789&utm_source=network&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=campaign) from reftag ``` You should also see a click package added to the SDK's package handler: ```text V/Adjust: Path: /sdk_click ClientSdk: android4.28.0 Parameters: app_token abc123abc123 click_time yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'Z created_at yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'Z environment sandbox gps_adid 12345678-0abc-de12-3456-7890abcdef12 needs_attribution_data 1 referrer adjust_reftag=abc123&tracking_id=123456789&utm_source=network&utm_medium=banner&utm_campaign=campaign reftag abc123 source reftag tracking_enabled 1 ``` If you perform this test before launching the app, you won't see the package being sent. The package will be sent once the app is launched We encourage you not to use the adb tool for testing this particular feature. If you have multiple parameters separated with &, you need to encode the content. If you do not encode it, adb will stop reading after the first & symbol. This will deliver the wrong content to your receiver. If you would like to test how your app receives unencoded referrer values, test with our [example app](https://github.com/adjust/android_sdk/tree/master/Adjust/example-app-java). You can alter the content you pass so that it fires with intent inside of the `onFireIntentClick` method in `MainActivity.java`: ```java public void onFireIntentClick(View v) { Intent intent = new Intent("com.android.vending.INSTALL_REFERRER"); intent.setPackage("com.adjust.examples"); intent.putExtra("referrer", "utm_source=test&utm_medium=test&utm_term=test&utm_content=test&utm_campaign=test"); sendBroadcast(intent); } ``` Feel free to alter the second parameter of `putExtra` method with content of your choice. === ### [Can I trigger an event at application launch?](trigger-event-app-launch) Triggering an event at app launch might not do what you expect. Android calls the `onCreate` method on the global `Application` class multiple times. It will call it at app launch, as well as when the app captures a system or app event. The Adjust SDK is ready for initialization at this point, but it will not have actually started. This will only happen when an activity takes place. For example: when a user launches the app. If you trigger an event at app launch the Adjust SDK would start and send the events. This would happen even if the app was not launched by the user and was instead triggered by external events. This means that triggering an event on app launch could lead to reporting inaccuracies. If you want to trigger an event after the install, use the [attribution callback](/en/article/attribution-callbacks-android-sdk). If you want to trigger an event when the user launches the app, use the `onCreate` method for the given activity. === ### [How big is the Adjust SDK?](how-big-is-the-adjust-sdk) The Adjust SDK measures between __50KB__ and __60KB__. +++<

# Set up Digital Turbine

Digital Turbine is a network and Adjust module partner. Our integration lets Digital Turbine receive attribution and in-app event data through automated callbacks. 

Use our basic setup instructions to turn on Adjust’s integration and send callbacks to Digital Turbine. Then, use our advanced setup instructions to customize what information Digital Turbine receives. 

## [Basic setup](basic-setup)


To turn on Adjust’s integration with Digital Turbine, follow these steps.

1. Find your app and select your app options caret (^)
2. Select Partner __Setup__ > __ADD PARTNERS__
3. Select the add (+) icon next to __Digital Turbine__
4. Turn on __Enabled__
5. Optional: see [advanced setup](#advanced-setup) to customize your callbacks
6. Select Save

Well done! Basic setup is complete. Now you can create an [Adjust tracker URL](https://help.adjust.com/en/article/basic-tracker-setup) and submit it to Digital Turbine to launch your campaign.

Digital Turbine will receive callbacks for these activities:

 - install
 - session
 - reattribution
 - event
 - rejectedInstall
 - rejectedReattribution

   
## [Advanced setup](advanced-setup)

Choose which data Digital Turbine receives from Adjust by customizing your setup.


### [Only forward data attributed to Digital Turbine](only-forward-data-attributed)

Adjust sends Digital Turbine your installs and reattributions across all ad platforms.

To stop Digital Turbine from receiving data attributed to other ad platforms, follow these steps.

1. Find your app and select your app options caret (^)
2. Select __Partner Setup__ > __Digital Turbine__
3. Turn on __Attributed Only__

Now Digital Turbine will only receive data attributed to their own platform.

### [Forward in-app revenue](forward-in-app-revenue)

In-app revenue forwarding lets Digital Turbine receive revenue amounts along with your revenue event data.

To forward in-app revenue to Digital Turbine, follow these steps.

1. Find your app and select your app options caret (^)
2. Select __Partner Setup__ > __Digital Turbine__
3. Turn on __In-App Revenue Forwarding__

Now Digital Turbine will receive the revenue amount for every tracked transaction.

__Note:__ Link at least one [revenue event](/en/article/revenue-events) to Digital Turbine before turning on In-App Revenue Forwarding.

### [Forward sessions](forward-sessions)

Adjust does not automatically send session callbacks due to the high volume of sessions.

To forward in-app sessions to Digital Turbine, follow these steps.

1. Find your app and select your app options caret (^)
2. Select __Partner Setup__ > __Digital Turbine__
3. Turn on __Session Forwarding__

Now Digital Turbine will receive your app’s session activity.

### [Forward in-app events](forward-in-app-events)

Event linking lets Digital Turbine receive in-app event data. You can link every in-app event in Adjust to a preset Digital Turbine name or a custom event name.

To forward in-app events to Digital Turbine, follow these steps.

1. Find your app and select your app options caret (^)
2. Select __Partner Setup__ > __Digital Turbine__ > __Event Linking__
3. Find the event you want to link and update the field with a Digital Turbine event or your own custom name
4. When you finish linking events, select __OK__
5. Select __Save__

Now Digital Turbine will receive in-app event data for each of your linked events.

## [Partner specific setup instructions](partner-specific-setup-instructions)


By default, Adjust sends callbacks to Digital Turbine's standard API. To enable Adjust to fire callbacks to Digital Turbine via their new API, please follow these steps.

1. Find your app and select your app options caret (^)
1. Select **Partner Setup** > **Digital Turbine**
1. Turn on **Enable New API (Optional)**

Now Digital Turbine may receive callbacks via their new API. 

**Note**: For more details about the new API , please reach out to your Digital Turbine representative.

## [List of all parameters forwarded to Digital Turbine](list-of-all-parameters-forwarded)

Digital Turbine requires Adjust to send the following parameters (data points) with your callbacks:

| Placeholder |	Information |
| ---------- | ---------- |
| `{gps_adid}` | Google Play Store advertising ID |
| `{match_type}` | Attribution method |
| `{revenue_usd}` | Revenue, in US dollars |
| `{sdk_version}` | Adjust SDK version (per app) |
| `{app_id}` | Store App ID or Google Play Store |
| `{impression_based}` | 1 if impression-based engagement, 0 if not |
| `{is_organic}` | 1 if organic traffic, 0 if non-organic |
| `{rejection_reason}` | Reason for a rejected attribution |
| `{is_s2s}` |  1 if server to server engagement, 0 if not |

fields.title: Ad network setup
fields.body:
Set up your ad networks to receive data for your campaigns, app installs, and in-app data measured by Adjust.

With this end-to-end setup, you can:
- [x] Create links associated with your ad network for your app
- [x] Enable data sharing
- [x] Set up deep links based on user's device type
- [x] Set attribution settings at the link level

You can create 4 levels of links: **network** (top level), **campaign** (sublevel 1), **adgroup** (sublevel 2), and **creative** (sublevel 3).
*   Only network-level links redirect to your app's store page. They do not contain sublevel data and use your app-level attribution settings.
*   You need to create a network-level link before you can create a sublevel link.

## [Before you begin](before-you-begin)

Here's what you need to know before getting started.

__Requirements__

- Admin, Editor, or Custom Editor [permissions](/en/article/permission-levels)
   - You should be able to set up your ad networks after you have added an app. If you face any issues, reach out to your Technical Account Manager or contact [support@adjust.com](mailto:support@adjust.com).

## [Get started](get-started)

The steps that you need to follow to set up your ad network depend on the network that you select. To get started with setting up your ad network, follow these steps.

1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__.
2. Select __New partner__.
3. In the __[Partner selection](/en/article/network-and-app-selection-ad-network#choose-network)__ screen, choose the ad network that you want to set up.
4. In the __[App selection](/en/article/network-and-app-selection-ad-network#choose-app)__ screen, choose the app for which you want to create the link.
5. (Optional) In the __[Data sharing](/en/article/data-sharing-ad-network)__ screen, configure the integration between your network and Adjust, and choose data sharing options. 
   - You will skip this step if you've already configured data sharing for the network and you're creating multiple links for an app.
6. In the __[Link structure](/en/article/link-structure-ad-network)__ screen, do the following:
   - If you're running campaigns with partners that support cross-device measurement, choose the use case of your link.
   - Provide the link name, and review the default link structure parameters provided by the network and update the values, if needed. If you're creating multiple links for an app, ensure that you provide a unique link name for each additional link that you create.
7. (Optional) In the __[User destinations](/en/article/user-destinations-ad-network)__ screen, configure a deep link, or add a redirect and fallback to your link.
8. (Optional) In the __[Attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network)__ screen, set custom attribution settings for new and existing users. These attribution settings are available for clicks and impressions.  If you skip this step, attribution settings that you chose during app setup will apply. 
9. In the __[Setup review](/en/article/review-setup-create-link-ad-network)__ screen, review your choices, and make any changes as necessary. 
10. Select __Create link__ to generate the click URL, impression URL, QR code, and link token, and enable data sharing, if set up.

## [Next steps](next-steps)

<callout type="important">
Enter your link URL in the network dashboard (at the campaign level).
</callout>

fields.title: Set up Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads
fields.body:
With Adjust's Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads integration, you can measure the performance of your marketing efforts on Yahoo! JAPAN campaigns. In this section, learn how to set up Yahoo! JAPAN for Android apps only. To set Yahoo! JAPAN for your iOS apps, choose Yahoo! Japan Ads Search Ads iOS, and follow the steps under Ad network setup. ## [How it works](how-it-works) __How does Adjust measure installs with Yahoo! JAPAN?__ 1. Since Yahoo! JAPAN does not use Adjust link URLs, Adjust sends them every app session our SDK reports. 2. If Yahoo! JAPAN recognizes the activity, they respond with the device identifier and timestamp. 3. Following our own attribution method, Adjust then uses the engagement data from all networks to attribute the install to the last source. ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) Here's what you need to know before getting started. __Requirements__ - Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads account - Link ID ## [Initial setup](initial-setup) To set up Yahoo! JAPAN for your app, follow these steps. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select __New partner__. 3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose __Yahoo!広告 検索広告 (yahoo! japan ads search ads)__, and select __Next__. This network is available for Android apps only. - To set Yahoo! JAPAN for your iOS apps, choose __Yahoo! Japan Ads Search Ads iOS__, and follow the steps under [Ad network setup](/en/article/ad-network-setup). 4. In the __App selection__ screen, choose your app, and select __Next__. Then, set your data sharing options, review your setup, and enable Yahoo! JAPAN for your app. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) Share data with Yahoo! JAPAN to optimize your campaigns. In the __Data sharing__ screen, follow these steps. ### [Enable data sharing for Yahoo! JAPAN](enable-data-sharing-for-yahoo-japan) In the __Link ID__ field, enter your Yahoo! JAPAN Link ID. ### [Set your data sharing options](set-your-data-sharing-options) Once you enable data sharing, Adjust sends Yahoo! JAPAN data for all installs and sessions attributed to them, from all attribution sources, by default. This includes data attributed to Yahoo! JAPAN, data attributed to other networks, and organic data. Additionally, select __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Yahoo! JAPAN. You need to [map events](#map-events) that generate revenue to share this data. ### [Map events](map-events) Map your events to forward in-app event data directly to Yahoo! JAPAN. If you selected __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Yahoo, ensure that you map at least one revenue event to Yahoo! JAPAN. To forward in-app events or revenue events to Yahoo! JAPAN, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map event__. 2. In the __Adjust event__ list, select the Adjust event that you want to share with Yahoo! JAPAN. 3. In the __Partner event__ list, select an applicable Yahoo! JAPAN event. 4. Select __Apply__. +++> ### Yahoo! JAPAN events available for mapping $$$> - `In App Purchase` - `View Item List` - `View Item` === - `View Search Results` - `Add to Cart` - `Ecommerce Purchase` $$$< +++< #### Event names All event names appear on Yahoo! JAPAN as you label them in Adjust. Spaces and special characters are replaced with an underscore (\_). Special characters that appear at the start or end of the name are deleted. Any series of two or more special characters are replaced with a single underscore. For example: `REVad_$$cost$$` in Adjust becomes `revad_cost` in Yahoo! JAPAN. #### Send the SDK version for server-to-server events We recommend that you send your SDK version along with any [server-to-server (S2S) events](/en/article/server-to-server-events). To do this, you need to use the formatted SDK version. This uses the following format: [platform][SDK version].
Platform SDK Version Formatted SDK Version
iOS 4.29.2 ios4.29.2
Android 4.28.1 android4.28.1
Once you have formatted the SDK version, make sure to send it via a custom request header named `Client-SDK`. +++> ### Example If the formatted SDK version is `ios4.29.2`, then the custom header would be defined in the following `curl` command: ```bash curl -X GET \\ 'https://s2s.adjust.com/event?s2s=1&event_token=f0ob4r&app_token=4w565xzmb54d&idfa =D2CADB5F-410F-4963-AC0C-2A78534BDF1E&created_at=2017-01-02T15%3A04%3A0 5Z%2B0200&callback_params=%7B%22f0o%22%3A%22bar%22%2C%20%22bar%22%3 A%22baz%22%7D&partner_params=%7B%22f0o%22%3A%22bar%22%2C%20%22bar% 22%3A%22baz%22%7D' \ -H 'Client-Sdk: ios4.29.2' ``` +++< ## [Setup review](setup-review) 1. In the __Setup review__ screen, review your choices. Make any changes, if required. 2. Select __Enable network__ to enable Yahoo! JAPAN for your app, and enable data sharing, if set up. You do not need to create a link Yahoo! JAPAN for Android apps. The links are created automatically after you set up and start a campaign with Yahoo! JAPAN. Adjust then starts attributing users to your campaigns. ## [Next steps](next-steps) 1. Go to Yahoo! JAPAN and set up your campaign. - Corresponding links are created automatically and appear on the network details page. 2. Import your linked events into Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads. In Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads, a conversion action is a specific user action that you have defined as valuable to your business, such as an online purchase. To import your Adjust events into Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads as conversion actions, follow [Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads' support documentation](https://ads-help.yahoo.co.jp/yahooads/ss/articledetail?lan=en&aid=6380&o=default) ([Japanese](https://ads-help.yahoo.co.jp/yahooads/ss/articledetail?lan=ja&aid=7678)). Once imported, Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads sends Adjust conversion data for conversion actions. Import all relevant conversion actions (both first open and any relevant in-app actions) into Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads before launching a Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads campaign. Adjust cannot report any Yahoo! JAPAN Ads Search Ads-driven app installs or in-app events until you have completed your import. 3. (Optional) Customize your attribution settings from the Yahoo! JAPAN network details page.

fields.title: Choose network and app
fields.body:
In this section, we will choose an ad network and an app for the selected ad network. 

## [Choose network](choose-network)

The steps that you need to follow to set up your ad network depend on the network that you select.

1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__.
2. Select __New partner__.
3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose the network that you want to set up. Use the __Search partners__ field to search for your network, or scroll through the list to find your network.
4. After you choose your network, select __Next__.

## [Choose app](choose-app)

1. In the __App selection__ screen, choose the app for which you want to create the link. Use the __Search apps__ field to search for your app, or scroll through the apps list to find your app. You can set up links for only one app at a time.
2. After you choose your app, select __Next__. 

</br> ➡️ Next: [__Choose data sharing options__](/en/article/data-sharing-ad-network)

fields.title: Manage your SAN setup
fields.body: Once you've set up your self-attributing network (SAN), you can: - View a list of all SANs that you've set up. - Drill down to view or edit campaign, adgroup, and creative levels of the link. - View a comparison of attribution settings across all your links. - View and edit your data sharing setup. ## [Self-attributing networks list](self-attributing-networks-list) This section provides a list of all SANs and other ad networks that you've set up. You can access the list by selecting __Campaign Lab > Partners__. __Available details__ - A list of all SANs and other ad networks that you've set up. - The number of apps with links for each SAN and ad network. - The number of apps with data sharing enabled. __Tasks__ - Select a SAN to view an overview of the network level details of the link. - Select __New link__ to [create a link for this SAN](/en/article/self-attributing-networks-setup#choose-app) for an app. - Select __New partner__ to [set up a SAN](/en/article/self-attributing-networks-setup) for an app. ## [Link overview](link-overview) This section provides details of your link and your SAN setup. Select a SAN from the __Partners__ list to view an overview of the network level details of a link. __Available details__ - The name of the app for which the link was set up. - The network level name of the link. - The number of campaigns set up on this link. __Task__ - Drill down into the [structure of your link](/en/article/manage-san-setup#link-structure). ### [Link structure](link-structure) This section provides details on how you can drill down into the structure of your link. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select a SAN that you've set up to view the network level details of the link. - View the network level name of the link. - View the number of configured campaigns. - Select the network name or (Edit icon) to view or edit the [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the network level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the link token. 3. Under __Campaigns__, select the campaign number or (Drill down icon) to drill down into campaign details. - View the campaign level name of the link. - View the number of configured adgroups. - Select the campaign name or (Edit icon) to view or edit the [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the campaign level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the link token. 4. Under __Adgroups__, select the adgroup number or (Drill down icon) to drill down into adgroup details. - View the adgroup level name of the link. - View the number of configured creatives. - Select the adgroup name or (Edit icon) to view or edit the [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the adgroup level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the link token. 5. Under __Creatives__, select the creative number or (Drill down icon) to drill down into creative details. - View the creative level name of the link. - Select the creative name or (Edit icon) to view or edit the [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) of the creative level of your link. - Select (More icon) to copy the link token. ## [Attribution settings comparison](attribution-settings-comparison) This section provides a comparison of [attribution settings](/en/article/attribution-settings-ad-network) across all your links for a SAN. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select a SAN that you've set up to view an overview of the network level details of the link. 3. Select __Attribution comparison__. __Available details__ - The name of the app for which the link was set up. - The values of click and impression attribution for: - Device matching - probabilistic modeling - Temporary attribution - The values of click and impression reattribution for: - Inactivity period - Reattribution window - Temporary reattribution - Custom attribution settings are highlighted. __Tasks__ - To modify an attribution setting, select its value and change it. Select __Save__. - Select the network level name to view all attribution settings of the link. - Select the campaign number or (Drill down icon) to view or modify a comparison of the attribution settings for the campaign level of the link. - From the campaign level, select the adgroup number or (Drill down icon) to view or modify a comparison of the attribution settings for the adgroup level of the link. From the agroup level, select the creative number or (Drill down icon) to view or modify a comparison of the attribution settings for the adgroup level of the link. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) This section provides details of your data sharing setup. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select a SAN that you've set up. 3. Select the __Data sharing__ tab. __Available details__ - The name of the app for which data sharing was set up. - The sources from which data is shared with the network. - The data points shared with the network. - The number of mapped events and parameters. - The data sharing status (__Active__ or __Paused__). __Tasks__ - Change data sharing status. - Select (Pause icon) to pause sharing data with your network. - Select (Resume icon) to start sharing data with your network again. - Select (Edit icon) to modify your [data sharing](/en/article/self-attributing-networks-setup#data-sharing) settings.

fields.title: Set up Google Ads
fields.body:
With Adjust’s [Google Ads integration](https://help.adjust.com/en/article/google-ads-integration), you can measure the performance of your marketing efforts for the following Google Ads campaigns. $$$> - Search - Display - Shopping === - Video - App $$$< ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) Here's what you need to know before getting started. __Requirements__ - A Google Ads account - A [Google Ads Link ID](https://support.google.com/adwords/answer/7365001) - Each of your apps should have only one Link ID associated with it on Google Ads. To avoid confusion, you can use one ad account to generate a single Link ID and share this Link ID with all other accounts. - Adjust SDK v4.0.0 and later to map SDK parameters to network parameters. Follow the guides linked below to use this feature.
[iOS](/en/article/record-events-ios-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Android](/en/article/event-tracking-android-sdk#partner-parameters) / [Windows](https://github.com/adjust/windows_sdk#8-partner-parameters) / [Unity](/en/article/measure-events-unity-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [React Native](/en/article/measure-events-react-native-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Flutter](/en/article/measure-events-flutter-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Adobe Air](https://github.com/adjust/adobe_air_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Cordova](https://github.com/adjust/cordova_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Marmalade](https://github.com/adjust/marmalade_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Xamarin](https://github.com/adjust/xamarin_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Cocos2d-x](https://github.com/adjust/cocos2dx_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Titanium](https://github.com/adjust/titanium_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Corona](https://github.com/adjust/corona_sdk#partner-parameters) ## [Initial setup](initial-setup) To set up Google Ads for your app, follow these steps. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Ad partners__. 2. Select __New partner__. 3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose __Google Ads__, and select __Next__. 4. In the __App selection__ screen, choose your app, and select __Next__. Then, set your data sharing options, review your setup, and enable Google Ads for your app. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) Share data with Google Ads to optimize your campaigns. In the __Data sharing__ screen, follow these steps. ### [Enable data sharing for Google Ads](enable-data-sharing-for-google-ads) In the __Link ID__ field, enter your Google Ads Link ID. Follow the steps in Google Ads documentation to find your [Google Ads Link ID](https://support.google.com/adwords/answer/7365001). ### [Set your data sharing options](set-your-data-sharing-options) Once you enable data sharing, Adjust sends install and session data from all attribution sources, by default. This includes data attributed to Google Ads, data attributed to other networks, and organic data. Additionally, you can choose to share the following data with Google Ads. 1. Select __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Google Ads. You need to [map events](#map-events) that generate revenue to share this data. 2. Select __Parameters__ to share all partner parameters configured in the Adjust SDK for any activity you share with Google Ads. You usually need to [map parameters](#map-parameters) to share this data. 3. Adjust measures reattributions for Google Ads automatically. Turn on __Enable reattribution measurement__ to send all app sessions to Google Ads. If Google Ads can show a qualifying engagement, it will be awarded a reattribution. 4. Turn on __Use Google Ads attribution window (30 days)__ to match the attribution window to the one used by Google Ads. - By default, the attribution window for all Google Ads regular campaign installs is set to 30 days, and Google Ads pre-registration campaigns are set to 90 days. These defaults will override your app’s attribution window settings.
Adjust recommends that you match Google Ads' attribution window with your apps to avoid install discrepancies. While not recommended, you can turn this off and customize your desired attribution window. ### [Map events](map-events) Mapped events must contain a valid IP address. If Adjust currently records your in-app events via a server-to-server integration, update your request to include an IP address using the parameter ip_address= All Adjust events are linked to Google Ads automatically. This means that Adjust sends in-app event data, from all sources, to Google Ads. Each event created for the app is mapped automatically to a custom name in Google Ads in the `event_{AdjustEventName}` format. To remove any of the automatically mapped events, select (Delete icon) next to the event name. You can also modify the automatically mapped event names. To do this, select (Edit icon) next to the event name, and choose a default name from the list, or enter a custom event name. If you selected __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Google Ads, ensure that you map at least one revenue event to Google Ads. If you had already created revenue events for your app, they are automatically available to Google Ads. Otherwise, create revenue events, and then follow these steps to map your revenue events. 1. Select __Map event__. 2. In the __Adjust event__ list, select the Adjust event that you want to share with Google Ads. 3. In the __Partner event__ list, select the Google Ads event or enter a custom event name. 4. Select __Apply__. +++> ### Google Ads events All event names appear in Google Ads as you label them in Adjust. Spaces and special characters are replaced with an underscore (`_`). Special characters that appear at the start or end of the name are deleted. Any series of two or more special characters are replaced with a single underscore. **Example:** `REVad_$$cost$$` in the Adjust becomes `revad_cost` in Google Ads. Here are the available default Adjust names that map to Google's in-app events: $$$> - `In App Purchase` - `View Item List` - `View Item` === - `View Search Results` - `Add to Cart` - `Ecommerce Purchase` $$$< +++< ### [Map parameters](map-parameters) If the raw data parameters you collect in the SDK differ from the values supported by Google Ads, you can define mappings so that Google Ads can receive that data. You can view this section only if you have selected __Parameters__ under __Set your data sharing options__. To map your parameters, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map parameter__. 2. In the __SDK parameter__ field, enter the name of your Adjust partner parameter as written in the Adjust SDK. 3. In the __Partner parameter__ field, enter the corresponding Google Ads parameter name. 4. Select __Apply__. After you set this up, Adjust will forward custom event details directly to Google Ads for any of your linked events. ## [Setup review](setup-review) 1. In the __Setup review__ screen, review your choices. Make any changes, if required. 2. Select __Enable network__ to enable Google Ads for your app, and enable data sharing, if set up. You don't need to create a link for Google Ads. The links are created automatically after you set up and start a campaign with Google Ads. Adjust then starts attributing users to your campaigns. ## [Next steps](next-steps) 1. Go to Google Ads and import linked events from Adjust. - In Google Ads, a conversion action is a specific user action that you have defined as valuable to your business, such as an online purchase. To import your Adjust events into Google Ads as conversion actions, follow [Google Ads' support documentation](https://support.google.com/adwords/answer/7382633). Once imported, Google Ads will begin to send Adjust conversion data for conversion actions. You must import all relevant conversion actions (both first open and any relevant in-app actions) into Google Ads before launching a Google Ads campaign. Adjust cannot report any Google Ads-driven app installs or in-app events until you have completed your import. 2. (Recommended) For S2S event requests, send your current SDK version. Google uses this to fully optimize your in-app event campaigns. To do this, you need the formatted SDK version. The format will be (platform)(SDK version). Here are some examples:
Platform SDK Version Formatted SDK Version
iOS 4.12.3 ios4.12.3
Android 4.18.0 android4.18.0
Once you've formatted the SDK version, always send it via a custom request header named `Client-SDK`. **Example:** If the formatted SDK version is ios4.12.3, then the custom header would be defined in the following curl command: curl -X GET \\ 'https://s2s.adjust.com/event?s2s=1&event_token=f0ob4r&app_token=4w565xzmb54d&idfa =D2CADB5F-410F-4963-AC0C-2A78534BDF1E&created_at=2017-01-02T15%3A04%3A0 5Z%2B0200&callback_params=%7B%22f0o%22%3A%22bar%22%2C%20%22bar%22%3 A%22baz%22%7D&partner_params=%7B%22f0o%22%3A%22bar%22%2C%20%22bar% 22%3A%22baz%22%7D' \ -H 'Client-Sdk: ios4.12.3' 2. (Optional) Customize your attribution settings for Google Ads. After your link is created via the network integration, attribution settings will be available from the network details page.

fields.title: Set up Twitter
fields.body:
As a Twitter Mobile App Conversion Tracking Partner (MACT), Adjust can measure your performance marketing efforts on Twitter. Twitter ads are organized by Twitter handles and Twitter Ads accounts. While each Twitter handle is directly associated with a specific Ads account, its access can be extended to include additional ad accounts within your Twitter interface. Therefore, apps in Adjust may be associated with various Ads accounts and any number of handles. All Twitter handles and Twitter Ads accounts can be precisely configured in managing data visibility and sharing. When making changes to your Twitter account setup, we always recommend pausing your Twitter campaigns, since the MACT API requires a complete re-sync of all modified account data. Twitter will only integrate with one MMP at a time. If you migrated from another MMP to Adjust, and the Twitter integration isn’t working, make sure you’ve disabled your Twitter integration with your previous MMP. If you’ve already closed your account with the previous MMP, contact them to confirm the Twitter integration is disabled. ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) Here's what you need to know before getting started. __Requirements__ - Twitter account credentials - Adjust SDK v4.0.0 and later to map SDK parameters to network parameters. Follow the guides linked below to use this feature.
[iOS](/en/article/record-events-ios-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Android](/en/article/event-tracking-android-sdk#partner-parameters) / [Windows](https://github.com/adjust/windows_sdk#8-partner-parameters) / [Unity](/en/article/measure-events-unity-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [React Native](/en/article/measure-events-react-native-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Flutter](/en/article/measure-events-flutter-sdk#add-partner-parameters) / [Adobe Air](https://github.com/adjust/adobe_air_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Cordova](https://github.com/adjust/cordova_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Marmalade](https://github.com/adjust/marmalade_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Xamarin](https://github.com/adjust/xamarin_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Cocos2d-x](https://github.com/adjust/cocos2dx_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Titanium](https://github.com/adjust/titanium_sdk#partner-parameters) / [Corona](https://github.com/adjust/corona_sdk#partner-parameters) ## [Initial setup](initial-setup) To set up Twitter for your app, follow these steps. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select __New partner__. 3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose __Twitter__. Now, Adjust checks if you have added your Twitter account in [DataWorks > Connections](/en/article/connect-partner-credentials). - If you have not added your Twitter account, go to the next step. - If you have already added your Twitter account, go to Step 5. 4. Select __Go to Connections__ to add your Twitter account, and follow these steps. 1. Accept Twitter's Mobile App Conversion Tracking (MACT) Terms & Conditions. 2. Select __Sign in with Twitter__. 3. Log in to Twitter with your account credentials, and select __Authorize app__. This automatically redirects you back to the Connections management page in DataWorks. 4. Select __Reload accounts__. 5. In the __App selection__ screen, choose your app, and select __Next__. Then, set your data sharing options, review your setup, and enable Twitter for your app. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) Share data with Twitter to optimize your campaigns. In the __Data sharing__ screen, follow these steps. ### [Enable data sharing for Twitter](enable-data-sharing-for-twitter) Choose the Twitter accounts that you want to share data with. Expand the accordion to choose the accounts associated with a Twitter handle, and select the accounts that you want to send data. Data that is sent to Twitter is determined by the accounts that you select for the selected app. The data sent is not separated by platform - Android or iOS. ### [Set your data sharing options](set-your-data-sharing-options) Once you enable data sharing, Adjust sends data from all attribution sources to Twitter by default. This includes data attributed to Twitter, data attributed to other networks, and organic data. Additionally, you can choose to share the following data with Twitter. 1. Select __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Twitter. You need to [map events](#map-events) that generate revenue to share this data. 2. Select __Parameters__ to share all partner parameters configured in the Adjust SDK for any activity you share with Twitter. You usually need to [map parameters](#map-parameters) to share this data. ### [Map events](map-events) Map your events to forward in-app event data directly to Twitter. If you selected __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Twitter, ensure that you map at least one revenue event to Twitter. To forward in-app events or revenue events to Twitter, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map event__. 2. In the __Adjust event__ list, select the Adjust event that you want to share with Twitter. 3. In the __Partner event__ list, select an applicable Twitter event. 4. Select __Apply__. +++> ### Twitter events available for mapping $$$> - `sign_up` - `login` - `purchase` - `update` - `level_achieved` - `added_payment_info` - `add_to_cart` - `add_to_wishlist` - `tutorial_complete` === - `checkout_initiated` - `rated` - `content_view` - `achievement_unlocked` - `spent_credits` - `search` - `reservation` - `share` - `invite` $$$< +++< ### [Map parameters](map-parameters) If the raw data parameters you collect in the SDK differ from the values supported by Twitter, you can define mappings so that Twitter can receive that data. You can view this section only if you have selected __Parameters__ under __Set your data sharing options__. To map your parameters, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map parameter__. 2. In the __SDK parameter__ field, enter the name of your Adjust partner parameter as written in the Adjust SDK. 3. In the __Partner parameter__ field, enter the corresponding Twitter parameter name. 4. Select __Apply__. After you set this up, Adjust forwards custom event details directly to Twitter for any of your linked events. +++> ### Supported Twitter parameters
Parameter name Content Example
registration_method A string describing the method of registration for the app associated with this event facebook, amazon
content_id Product or content ID associated with an event (string) 9826193
price_currency Currency code (three-letter ISO 4217) EUR, USD, JPY
price_micro Price associated with the event in micro-currency units 123450000 (i.e., $123.45)
level A level, e.g., in a game 5
number_items Number of items associated with the event 2
search_string Any search string used Adjust + twitter integration
user_payment_info Boolean to denote whether or not the user's payment information is stored in the app true or false
max_rated_value A double value to indicate the maximum rated value of this event 3.5
description Any miscellaneous string description Adjust is nifty
+++< ## [Setup review](setup-review) 1. In the __Setup review__ screen, review your choices. Make any changes, if required. 2. Select __Enable network__ to enable Twitter for your app, and enable data sharing, if set up. You do not need to create a link for Twitter. The links are created automatically after you set up and start a campaign with Twitter. Adjust then starts attributing users to your campaigns. ## [Next steps](next-steps) 1. Go to Twitter and set up your campaign. - Corresponding links are created automatically and appear on the network details page. 2. (Optional) Customize your attribution settings from the Twitter network details page. ### [Receive Twitter attribution data via raw export data](send-twitter-attribution-data-via-raw-export-data) Adjust always reports Twitter attributions. By default, raw data export displays Twitter attributions as `Organic`. To receive Twitter attribution data via raw data export, follow these steps. 1. Join the Twitter Advanced Mobile Measurement (AMM) Program. Sign into your Twitter account and complete [this form](https://business.twitter.com/en/form/mact-data-opt-in.html). You may need to contact your Twitter Account Manager to complete this process. 2. Notify Adjust that you have joined the Twitter AMM program. Contact your Adjust Technical Account Manager or support@adjust.com for them to complete the process. Once Adjust has completed the process, you can see Twitter attributions for eligible users in your raw data export. Users who have opted out of [additional information sharing with business partners](https://help.twitter.com/en/safety-and-security/data-through-partnerships) on their Twitter accounts, or who are otherwise ineligible for information sharing, appear as `Organic` in your raw data export. In order for Adjust to confirm that you are active in the Twitter AMM Program, you must currently be running Twitter campaigns. You may need to confirm with your Twitter Account Manager.

fields.title: Set up Yahoo
fields.body:
With Adjust’s Yahoo integration, you can measure the performance of your marketing efforts on Yahoo campaigns. ## [How it works](how-it-works) __How does Adjust measure installs with Yahoo?__ 1. Since Yahoo does not use Adjust link URLs, Adjust sends them every app session our SDK reports. 2. If Yahoo recognizes the activity, they respond with the device identifier and timestamp. 3. Following our own attribution method, Adjust then uses the engagement data from all networks to attribute the install to the last source. ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) Here's what you need to know before getting started. __Requirements__ - App Store App ID or Google Play Store ID - [Pixel ID](https://developer.yahoo.com/gemini/advertiser/guide/targeting/custom-audiences/faqs/#where-do-i-find-my-yahoo-conversion-tag-id) (Also called Yahoo Conversion Tag ID) ## [Initial setup](initial-setup) To set up Yahoo for your app, follow these steps. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Ad partners__. 2. Select __New partner__. 3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose __Yahoo__, and select __Next__. 4. In the __App selection__ screen, choose your app, and select __Next__. Then, set your data sharing options, review your setup, and enable Yahoo for your app. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) Share data with Yahoo to optimize your campaigns. In the __Data sharing__ screen, follow these steps. ### [Enable data sharing for Yahoo](enable-data-sharing-for-yahoo) 1. In the __App ID__ field, enter your App Store or Google Play Store ID. 2. (Optional) Enter the __Pixel ID__. ### [Set your data sharing options](set-your-data-sharing-options) Once you enable data sharing, Adjust sends Yahoo data for all installs attributed to them, from all attribution sources, by default. This includes data attributed to Yahoo, data attributed to other networks, and organic data. Additionally, select __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Yahoo. You need to [map events](#map-events) that generate revenue to share this data. ### [Map events](map-events) Map your events to forward in-app event data directly to Yahoo. If you selected __In-app revenue (from in-app purchases)__ to send detailed revenue data to Yahoo, ensure that you map at least one revenue event to Yahoo. While mapping network events, you need to choose action names and categories for the corresponding Adjust event. To forward in-app events or revenue events to Yahoo, follow these steps. 1. Select __Map event__. 2. In the __Adjust event__ list, select the Adjust event that you want to share with Yahoo. 3. Under __Partner event__, set up action names and categories for the Adjust event. To locate action names and categories within Yahoo, select __Shared Library tab > Conversion Rules > In app events__. 1. In the __Action__ list, select an action from the list or enter a custom action name. 2. In the __Category__ list, select a predefined Yahoo event that matches closely with the Adjust event or enter a custom category name. 4. Select __Apply__. +++> ### Yahoo action names $$$> - `AchievedLevel` - `ActivatedApp` - `AddedPaymentInfo` - `AddedToCart` - `AddedToWishlist` - `CompletedRegistration` - `CompletedTutorial` - `InitiatedCheckout` === - `Purchased` - `Rated` - `Searched` - `Lead` - `SignUp` - `SpentCredits` - `UnlockedAchievement` - `ViewedContent` $$$< === ### Yahoo categories $$$> - `Gaming` - `Engagement` - `Lead` === - `Purchase` - `AddtoCart` - `SignUp` $$$< +++< ## [Setup review](setup-review) 1. In the __Setup review__ screen, review your choices. Make any changes, if required. 2. Select __Enable network__ to enable Yahoo for your app, and enable data sharing, if set up. You do not need to create a link for Yahoo. The links are created automatically after you set up and start a campaign with Yahoo. Adjust then starts attributing users to your campaigns. ## [Next steps](next-steps) 1. Go to Yahoo and set up your campaign. - Corresponding links are created automatically and appear on the network details page. 2. (Optional) Customize your attribution settings from the Yahoo network details page. ## [FAQs](faqs) +++> ### [What Yahoo data does Adjust report?](what-yahoo-data-does-adjust-report) In Adjust, your Yahoo data appears as:
Adjust link level Yahoo details
Network (top-level) Yahoo Gemini Installs
Campaign (sublevel 1) campaign_name (campaign_id)
Adgroup (sublevel 2) adgroup_name (adgroup_id)
Creative (sublevel 3) creativename_siteid (creative_id)
=== ### [Where can I find my Pixel ID?](where-can-i-find-my-pixel-id) Your Pixel ID is also listed as your `Yahoo Conversion Tag ID`. To find it, [follow these steps](https://developer.yahoo.com/gemini/advertiser/guide/targeting/custom-audiences/faqs/#where-do-i-find-my-yahoo-conversion-tag-id) in Yahoo. === ### [Where is my event name and category displayed in Yahoo?](where-is-my-event-name-and-category-displayed-in-yahoo) To locate event names and categories within Yahoo, select **Shared Library tab > Conversion Rules > In app events**. === ### [Why isn't Adjust measuring Yahoo campaigns?](why-isnt-adjust-measuring-yahoo-campaigns) There are several possible explanations: **Improper integration setup.** Once you've configured Yahoo in Campaign Lab, Adjust will measure all of your Yahoo campaigns, automatically. Verify if you've enabled Yahoo correctly in Adjust. **Installs claimed by Yahoo fall outside of the attribution window.** Adjust will only report installs in instances that conversions have occurred within the applicable attribution window. Therefore, if Yahoo reports an install driven outside of Adjust's attribution window, the install could be attributed as organic. === ### [Why does Datascape show fewer (or more) installs than Yahoo?](#why-does-datascape-show-fewer-or-more-installs-than-yahoo) In the case of a reported install discrepancy, we always recommend that you consider the following: **Different attribution windows.** Confirm that the attribution windows in both platforms are the same. By default, Adjust records all installs within a 7-day last-click and 24-hour last-impression window. **Different time zones.** Confirm that the time zones in both platforms are the same. **Assess your acquisition strategy.** If you are advertising on multiple channels, then check if it's possible that a reported Yahoo user could have been attributed elsewhere within Adjust. +++<

fields.title: Choose app
fields.body:
In this section, we will choose an app for your link.

1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Custom links__.
2. Select __New link__.
3. In the __App selection__ screen, choose the apps for which you want to create the link. Use the __Search apps__ field to search for your apps, or scroll through the apps list to find your apps.
   - Choosing one single-platform app or a multi-platform app creates a link wth a single link token.
   - Choosing multiple apps configured for different platforms creates a [combined link](/en/article/custom-link-setup#combined-custom-links) with multiple link tokens, each separated by an `_`. You can only select one app per platform.
4. After you choose your apps, select __Next__.

</br> ➡️ Next: [__Build your link structure__](/en/article/link-structure-custom-link)

fields.title: Set up Apple Ads
fields.body: Adjust uses the Apple Ads Attribution API and Apple Search Ads Campaign Management API to measure your campaigns with Apple Ads. For more information, see [How Apple Search Ads attribution works](/en/article/how-apple-search-ads-attribution-works). ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) Here’s what you need to know before you get started. __Requirements__ - Ensure you have the [Adjust iOS SDK 4.25.0](/en/article/get-started-ios-sdk) or later. - Add the [AdServices](/en/article/get-started-ios-sdk#add-ios-frameworks) framework to your app. - Your Apple Ads login credentials. - Your Apple ID needs to have admin permissions for the Apple Ads account(s) that you want to link. ## [Add Apple Ads account in Adjust](add-apple-ads-account-in-adjust) Apple Search Ads (ASA) offers two options for their customers: - Basic - Advanced Apple's Campaign Management API that provides campaign information and ad spend data is only available for customers using the Advanced solution. Customers on the Basic solution will see their measurement parameters as unknown in Adjust. In addition to using the Advanced option of Apple Search Ads, you need to link your Apple Ads account in Adjust to see campaign details and measure ad spend data. You do not need to set up Apple Ads for your app under Campaigns > Ad networks. Follow these steps to add your Apple Ads account. 1. Under __DataWorks__, select __Connections__. 2. Select __New Connection__. 3. Select __Apple/Apple Ads__. 4. Select __Connect Account__. 5. Log in to your Apple ID that has Apple Ads admin permissions. 6. On the __Select Permissions__ screen, choose the permissions that you want to grant Adjust: - If Adjust is only retrieving ad spend data from Apple Ads, select __Account Read Only__. - If Adjust is managing bids and budgets for Apple Ads, select __Account Read & Write__. 7. Select __Save__. ## [(Optional) Implement the consent pop-up](optional-implement-the-consent-pop-up) Add the AppTrackingTransparency framework to your app and implement the [Popup, then Initialize](/en/article/launch-the-att-pop-up-and-initialize-the-sdk) approach. This allows Adjust to receive the [detailed payload from Apple](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/ad_services/aaattribution/3697093-attributiontoken#3697463) for users with an authorized ATT status. With the detailed payload, Apple provides the click timestamp, which allows Adjust to perform more accurate attribution. Apple still sends the standard payload for users without an authorized ATT status, so Adjust can still attribute all iOS 14.3+ users regardless of ATT status. For more information, see [Apple Search Ads - Response types](/en/article/how-apple-search-ads-attribution-works#response-types). ## [Next steps](next-steps) Once you've set up your campaign in Apple Ads, links are automatically available on the Apple network details page under __Campaigns > Partners__. - (Optional) Customize your attribution settings from the Apple network details page.

fields.title: Set up Amazon Fire
fields.body:
With Adjust's Amazon SAN integration, you can measure the impact of campaigns you run on Amazon Fire devices that drive installs of your Android mobile app. Here, you can find information about how to connect Adjust to Amazon in the Adjust dashboard, and send Adjust data server-to-server (S2S). ## [Before you begin](before-you-begin) __Requirement__ - An Amazon App ID - This is 32 characters long and only includes numbers and lowercase letters. __What you need to know__ Amazon is a self-attributing network. This means that Adjust sends Amazon data for all of your app's installs and Amazon self-attributes using their own engagement data. Adjust then checks this data to confirm the source of the last engagement. ## [Initial setup](initial-setup) To set up Amazon Fire for your app, follow these steps in Adjust. 1. Under __Campaign Lab__, select __Partners__. 2. Select __New partner__. 3. In the __Partner selection__ screen, choose __Amazon Fire__, and select __Next__. 4. In the __App selection__ screen, choose your app, and select __Next__. Then, set your data sharing options, review your setup, and enable Amazon Fire for your app. ## [Data sharing](data-sharing) Share data with Amazon Fire to optimize your campaigns. In the __Data sharing__ screen, follow these steps. ### [Enable data sharing for Amazon Fire](enable-data-sharing-for-amazon-fire) In the __Amazon App ID__ field, enter your Amazon App ID for that platform. This enabled data sharing with Aamzon. - You can find your App ID in your Amazon Developer Console. Following [Amazon's instructions](https://developer.amazon.com/docs/adm/obtain-credentials.html), navigate to Security Profile Management, select the Web Settings tab, and copy the App ID from the full Client ID. - Client ID example: `amzn1.devportal.mobileapp.1234a5b67c8901d2e3456789012f3456` - App ID example: `1234a5b67c8901d2e3456789012f3456` Once you enable data sharing, Adjust sends install and reattribution data from all attribution sources, by default. This includes data attributed to Amazon Fire, data attributed to other networks, and organic data. Additionally, you can choose to share the following data with Amazon Fire. - Sessions - Events ### [Map events](map-events-1) Under each Adjust-tracked in-app event you will see a field with a drop-down menu. Use the dropdown menu to select a predefined Amazon event that maps to your Adjust-tracked event. Custom events cannot be sent. $$$> - Add to cart - Ad start - Ad finish - App engagement - App open - Banner interaction - Cable authentication - Email interaction - Email load - Game interaction - Game load - In App refferal - Install - Level achieved - Marketing landing page === - Other - Product purchased - Purchase button - Subscription button - Subscription page - Subscription restart - Subscription start - Survey start - Survey finish - Trial sign up page - Trial start - Video start - Video finish - Widget interaction - Widget load $$$< ## [Server-to-server integration](server-to-server-integration) Adjust needs to enable this feature for you. Contact your Technical Account Manager or support@adjust.com to proceed. With Amazon Fire set up as a network in Adjust, you can now set up server-to server integration with Adjust.
